page.title: 01Flotta & Fara
page.content: Both the islands lie at the south end of Scapa Flow. Fara is uninhabited and is rough moorland. Flotta is inhabited by about 100 people engaged in farming. However the dominant feature here is the Flotta oil terminal. Oil is piped here from the Piper & Claymore oilfields in the north sea. The volatile gases are seperated off, then it is taken away by tanker for refining elsewhere. Most of the employees at the terminal commute by boat from Orkney mainland. There is a small airstrip on the west of Flotta to service the oil terminal. The remaining land being covered with moorland and heather.
